file_content.text: You eclipse my greatest hopes for you and prove you belong at my side.
Which makes my susceptibility to Duke Kendoh's gossip about you all the more foolish.
Are you going to tell me what that maggot said or not?
Enlighten me.
You said it, I didn't.
I agree.
I have learned to follow all roads to their conclusion. So when I hear something alarming, I always pursue it.
Let the fool have his little amusements.
Who cares?
But they come at your expense, apprentice.
First off, Kendoh said that you set an explosion that caused the death of several Thul dignitaries.
That was his doing, not mine.
Not true.
Hmm. It must be politically advantageous for him to disavow his role in such a thing.
That was just collateral damage from our mission.
Couldn't be helped.
Ah, I see. No matter, then.
I'll kill that worm.
He'll pay for that.
I assume then, that wasn't the case. Shouldn't surprise me.
Kendoh also said that you helped the Republic defend their front in Organa's war against House Ulgo. Painting you as a traitor.
Kendoh also said that you had the general of Organa's military forces at your mercy, and you spared her. Suggesting that you're a traitor.
Doing so expedited my mission.
Had to be done.
Well, I do not care about the trivial war on Alderaan.
That is a lie. I killed the General.
She's dead.
I sense no tremor of deceit in you.
You know I'm no traitor.
That's nonsense.
It would surprise me to discover such a thing, but I cannot assume anything for certain.
Give me permission to kill him.
Let me make him pay.
All that matters to me is that your mission is complete. For whatever reason, the man has taken it upon himself to slander you.
I have no further use for Duke Kendoh. Punish him however you please. If it were me, he'd pay severely.
I'm interested to hear what he has to say for himself.
I'll go talk to the man.
I'm impervious to his antics.
He doesn't bother me.
I'm going to destroy him.
Do what you will, but quickly. Until we destroy the threat of Jaesa Willsaam, nothing else is important.
Goodbye, apprentice.
Ah, apprentice, the Sith FimmRess who attends Duke Kendoh was able to patch me through to you directly. Excellent.
I am seeking an update. News of your search for Jaesa Willsaam's family has reached me, and I am quite concerned.
What news have you heard, my lord?
Why is that?
No need to be concerned. I've killed her parents.
I already handled it.
Oh. I see. It appears I have been misinformed about your status.
No cause for concern. I sent her parents to you.
I already handled it.
Relax, old man, all is under control.
You're such a worrier.
That's not what I am hearing.
Duke Kendoh contacted me to tell me that you have been busying yourself with personal exploits, and disregarding my mission.
What exactly did he say about me?
Personal exploits?
In a moment. First, the more important subject.
That couldn't be farther from the truth.
Lies.
I hope that is the case.
You believed him? He's a fool.
You should know better.
I know to take him with a grain of salt, but you've been there for some time.
Tell me you've found the family of Nomen Karr's Padawan. Tell me they have been taken care of.
She no longer has a family.
They're dead.
I made them swear allegiance to the Empire and sent them to Dromund Kaas.
Her parents are coming to you.
Really? Excellent thinking. As I torture them, their pain will scream into the galaxy and torment their daughter.
I promised them riches, and I believe it will be more effective if they live fruitfully.
That's a bad idea.
Ah, very conniving. The happier they are under Imperial rule, the more it will tear at the Jedi's heart. I will make it so.
I've done my part. It's up to you now. Do what you will to them.
It's your decision.
Yes, I deceived them into agreeing to go.
That was my plan all along.
Yes, master, the situation has been handled.
It is done.
You insult me by insinuating otherwise.
I'm offended.
Then all is well. Good. No doubt the Padawan is twisting with grief.
Apprentice. I see you've touched down on Alderaan, Jaesa Willsaam's home planet, where Nomen Karr found her. Excellent.
Ah, you've touched down on Alderaan, the home planet of Nomen Karr's Padawan, where he claimed her for the Jedi. Good, good.
You will discover everything you can about this Padawan, and destroy everyone she loves there.
Absolutely.
I hope your results will confirm your confidence.
What are we trying to achieve?
For what purpose?
It is the same mandate as Tatooine. Assault Jaesa from afar, stir her emotions and flush her to the surface.
Nomen Karr shields her. We must assault the youngster from afar. Stir her emotions. Draw her out, so that we may strike.
I'll decide what is to be done on this planet.
Don't give me orders.
You have a long leash, apprentice. But there is much less wiggle room here.
Unfortunately, with the civil war for the Alderaanian throne raging, your contact, Duke Kendoh of House Thul, has become unreliable.
Kendoh was supposed to find Jaesa Willsaam's family for you, but it seems he's distracted. You must undistract him.
Kendoh was to discover more about the Padawan--her name, loved ones... but he's distracted. You must realign his priorities.
Right away.
Why don't I just kill him?
Maybe he should be dead.
No doubt someday the man's usefulness will be exhausted. But today is not that day.
So, I have to mop up your mess.
I'll control what you can't.
Take care not to become one of "my messes" yourself, apprentice.
Kendoh is a political creature--the consequences of failing me are abstract for him. Once they are made concrete, he'll cooperate.
You'll find him in the House Thul executive chambers. Make haste.
